snippet: Syrian rebels appeared to have fulfilled their end of a deal with the government to leave their bastion in Homs, but a United Nations official said the refugee crisis was worsening.
abstract: Last busloads of insurgents leave battered Old City of Homs in central Syria, under deal handing over longtime bastion of rebellion to the government after nearly two years of blockade and bombardment; deal appears to be successful, but United Nations officials warn that refugee crisis is worsening.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and NICK CUMMING-BRUCE
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva. Hwaida Saad and Mohammad Ghannam contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Syrian rebels appeared to have fulfilled their end of a deal with the government to leave their bastion in Homs, but a United Nations official said the refugee crisis was worsening.

headline.main: A Pulverized Prize Changes Hands, Peacefully, in Syria
headline.print_headline: A Pulverized Prize Changes Hands, Peacefully, in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
